headline: Quick Crispy Parmesan Chicken Breasts
description: This quick and easy recipe for crispy Parmesan chicken breasts goes well with pasta, on a salad, or even on its own.
name: Quick Crispy Parmesan Chicken Breasts
recipeIngredient: 4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, pounded to an even thickness

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil and spray with cooking spray.
Whisk bread crumbs, Parmesan cheese, paprika, salt, and black pepper together in a shallow bowl. Stir butter, white wine, mustard, and garlic together in another bowl.

Dip each chicken breast half into melted butter mixture; press into bread crumb mixture to evenly coat. Place breaded chicken in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet. Pat any leftover bread crumb mixture onto chicken breasts.

Bake chicken in the preheated oven until no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 20 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).

review.reviewBody: It was delicious. Iam not a good good. The directions were easy to follow and cooking time was perfect. It even had a great crust. Thanks for this recipe.
Place them on a rack atop the cookie sheet ;-) nice crispy breading on both sides evenly then IMO
This was so simple and delicious! I made spaghetti on the side and a salad and we didn't need anything else. Thank you!
Moist and crunchy
I'm all about breaded chicken and this was a great take on it! Loved it!

I have made this recipe quite a few times. We love it!! The chicken is always juicy and we LOVE the flavor. I double both of the coating mixes. This recipe will continue to be a regular in my kitchen!

Delicious definitely a keeper. who needs to fry. I did have panko crumbs so I substituted old Italian bread on the kitchenaide and mixed all of the dry ingredients as instructed. I also had no Dijon but had a Popeyes Madri gran mustard dipping sauce so I used that instead. had to add the wine duh! and followed the rest of the recipe. Sat back and enjoyed more wine. it was fantastic. so good I would make it for company served with green beans and some risotto, they will think you are a culinary genius.
Amazing - my kids gave it a 10 out of 10! So juicy and so easy to make. Added mashed potatoes and green beans and it was a home run. Will totally make it again!
The family enjoyed it. I did omit the wine and put the chicken on a rack and turned it halfway.
delicious!

Total hit with the whole family. I made the breasts into thin strips instead of hammering them flat, and then prepared the recipe as listed (double portions due to more surfaces) and used my air fryer. Same great taste as the original recipe, but made toddler friendly for my grandson.

I really enjoyed the flavor from the wine and garlic on this dish. No leftovers from this dinner!
My only comment was the butter/wine mixture wasn't enough for me. The bread crumb amount was right on the money. I had maybe a little more chicken than the recipe called for but I will still double that part of the recipe the next time.
Used Ritz crackers for breadcrumbs. Great recipe!
Delicious and quick weeknight dinner.
easy and delicious! Followed the recipe as is and it's awesome.
This recipe is so delicious that my son and I make it weekly now. So much flavor! Very easy to make.

I would have given this five stars but I had to follow others’ suggestions and tripled the dipping batter. Other than that, it’s a great recipe. The chicken was delicious, not dry, quick and easy to prep and bake. Will definitely make again!
Delicious! I followed the recipe exactly and it was a hit. I will definitely make this again.
Loved it - a new favorite!!!

Have to agree with other reviewers that a bit more butter mix and coating would be a good thing...I had just barely enough. I also turned on the broiler for a few minutes at the end to get them a bit browner.
One of my “go to” chicken recipes! Quick and easy and my family loves it!

I didn't have panko bread crumbs so used whole wheat crumbs (I put heels of my homemade bread through my food processor and keep them in the freezer). Other than that, I followed the recipe exactly and was very happy with the results; my husband commented several times on how much he liked it. I'll definitely fix it again!
will make again, kids loved it ate everything

Delicious! Finally baked chicken that my husband and kids really enjoyed! Very close to fried in the pan but much more tastier! I did not have Dijon mustard so I used honey mustard instead. Totally recommend making the recipe!
I didn’t have white wine or Dijon mustard, so I just left them out. It still turned out great.

Delicious! Only change I made was to use gluten-free panko bread crumbs, for the celiacs in the family. I don't know if that was the reason the coating didn't brown but I broiled the breasts for a few minutes at the end of the baking time to crisp it up.
Love this recipe! Will be using it in our household from now on! Thank you!
So good! We added rice and a red sauce to make our own chicken Parmesan!
Very good! I tried to make it as is but my panko bread crumbs were seasoned so I would recommend omitting salt. I didn't have white wine. I will make this again!
Very easy and tasty!! Did not use wine but not sure that it would have improved the taste. I used my air fryer and flipped the breasts half way through the cooking time. Nice and crispy!!
This so yummy!! My family loved it. Fast meal, easy to prepare and doesn’t take long at all. I will be making this again very soon!
I used very large breasts so they took extra time in the oven. I kept watch with a thermometer. The crust was great because I double dipped the coating.
Delicious! Quick and easy, and fairly low-carb.

Made this recipe a couple of days ago. It's fantastic and so easy, moist and full of flavor. Had the left over pieces the next afternoon and they were also fantastic. I am not that fond of the taste of chicken left overs, but this recipe proved excellent. Didn't and won't change anything.
I have made this several times and it is juicy and delicious every time. I have also followed this recipe for pork and baked cod. It is fabulous!
What can I say, but that it's the perfect combo. Plain, or as an addition.

I loved it! It was so tasty and so easy to make! It didn’t take long, so it was perfect for a weekday evening meal. I found that my chicken was still a bit pink after 20 minutes, so I left it in for 5 more & it was perfect!
Perfect just as the recipe is written! This has become one of our favorites. Thank you for sharing.
Love this juicy well seasoned chicken recipe. Hubby is a happy camper with a serving in front of him. Made enough to freeze for a lazy day quick meal.

My son and I love this recipe! So moist and delicious! I don’t use the wine, and mustard on occasion, when I have it. It’s a great flavor with it, but with the garlic and seasoned bread crumbs, the flavor is there! 5 stars.

I really liked this, despite the fact that I forgot to add the garlic. Fiance gave it 4 stars, saying too much Parmesan cheese flavor. Perhaps if I didn't forget the garlic, it would have balanced it out better for him. I will make it again.

I really liked this, despite the fact that I forgot to add the garlic. Fiance gave it 4 stars, saying too much Parmesan cheese flavor. Perhaps if I didn't forget the garlic, it would have balanced it out better for him. I will make it again.
I used Panko Crumbs as I had seen in other dishes and not bread crumbs. turned out tender and juicy. It was a thumbs up from the family.
We loved it. Easy and very moist.
very good, however for my taste will leave out the salt and increase the temp a bit to make a little crispier.
Made this exactly as directed with only 2 chicken breasts. Cut ingredients in half. Baked at 400 degrees for 35-40 minutes. So tender and juicy! Delicious and very easy!
Followed recipe exactly. Perfect, moist, tender chicken. Grandkids ate it up. Won't pan fry ever again.
A great quick dish. I decided to try it since I had all the ingredients on hand. It was a hit with the family... very tasty!
This is very flavorful, plus quick and easy. I used seasoned Panko bread crumbs, but added Parmesan cheese to it. I’ll definitely make this again .
No changes made and yes I will do this easy recipe again.
It was delicious l dropped my servings down to one. Worked out very well. I am a diabetic so the nutritional #s are good for me. Chicken was very juicy & tasty. I will make it again & again.
My husband and i loved them. We put them on top of pasta topped in marina sauce. It tasted restaurant quality and it was all with items we had on hand. Will definitely make them again.
Moist and juices. The Dijon mustard added some zing to the recipe. Used chicken broth in place of the wine. Still delicious. Will be a go to meal for me!

This chicken has really good flavor! I used dry sherry since I had no wine open and olive oil instead of butter. Next time I make this, I will marinade it in the wet ingredients and maybe make more of it for that purpose. I made more coating than the recipe called for because I had huge chicken breasts from the meat market.

My family loves this recipe! The only thing I do differently is instead of using butter I use olive oil. I made this one time with melted butter and it began to solidify on my cold chicken breasts. It still turns out yummy but so does the olive oil!

I made this exactly as the recipe. The only difference was that I cooked the chicken for @15min, then turned to crisp both sides. Turned the broiler on for a couple of min to re crisp the top. Delicious

I have made this several times now...I've added it to my regular rotation of favorite meals! It is so so good! Do not leave out the white wine. I usually double the recipe because I use Costco chicken breasts and they are pretty big. I slice the chicken in half to make it less thick, then I cut in half again so the pieces aren't huge. I bake on a rack so it's crispy on both sides. I pair with my creamy parmesan mashed potatoes and steamed broccoli and my family goes nuts! This is an absolutely delicious recipe, thank you for sharing!
I did not flatten my chicken. But it had barely enough coating for 2 regular pieces. I also used garlic and Parmigiano butter. Would make it again with less salt.
Delicious, moist yet crispy. Great flavors just had to cook longer than I expected probably due to the size of the breasts. Would make again as it is simple and I have most of the ingredients.
I liked it but next time may put it under the broiler for more crispness
This was awesome. I used gluten free bread crumbs and sliced the chicken a little thinner to make sure it was cooked through. Will definitely make these again
Awesome recipe. I added an egg white to the butter/Dijon mix. The chicken breasts came out moist and tender. Also, the same recipe worked great with thick cut boneless pork chops.
All four of us liked it including my seven and two year olds. Easy to make on a busy weeknight too!
Easy, but sophisticated enough for company.
Very flavorful! Really enjoyed this dish!
it came out great
Really great! I used garlic power instead of a clove of garlic and it turned out fine.
very good, easy to make
No I did not make changes and I will definitely cook it again.

I thought this was really good. I used honey Dijon mustard because that’s what I had. Next time I will use this on chicken tenders rather than breasts because I think the breading to chicken ratio will be better. Definitely will be making again!

It already has five stars so we know it’s good. And it’s Versatile! I changed it at the last minute, though. Had just put the mustard in the bowl and I suddenly decided that with Parmesan cheese I’m thinking Italian! I removed the mustard and added Italian season . Also substituted water for wine. The cold chicken caused the butter to harden so I think next time I will dip the chicken in buttermilk first instead of butter. 
Note to any novice cooks: Critical to the success of this dish is flattening the chicken breasts —pounding and making thin, particularly if you use the supermarket chicken breasts which are huge due to growth hormone. I flattened my chicken breasts to about half an inch and they were actually doubled in size; so you’ll need a large pan.
My family loved this! Requested to make again often??

One of the best, easiest chicken recipes I have made. 4 adults and 4 kids all loved it. Even my 1 yr old granddaughter loved it! She only has four teeth- it was so cute to watch her enjoy!
I was a little short on Panko so added some Italian breadcrumbs, otherwise followed the recipe exactly.

This is a good basic recipe for boneless chicken that can be adapted to what you have on hand! I used tenders, so had to cook a little longer but still turned out moist and slightly crispy. Will keep handy!
This chicken was delicious. I made the recipe as written and the whole family enjoyed it. This was so easy to make, it is now part of my weekly rotation.
This chicken was delicious. I made the recipe as written and the whole family enjoyed it. This was so easy to make, it is now part of my weekly rotation.
I loved this! I wasn’t able to use the white wine, but it still turned out really good. I’m definitely going to make this again.
I thought this was a bit bland, but next time I'll add some Italian herbs. I didn't need to flatten the breast, and mine was done in 20 minutes, leaving the chicken moist and tender.

I was starving, so to get this flavorful chicken in 20 min was great. Very easy to make. I put white wine & regular yellow mustard because it was all I had. oh yeah and 1 tsp of Italian seasoning I am going to run out & get dijion mustard now lol.
try it, It is delicious!
Kids loved it!
I used Italian Panko bread crumbs combined with roasted garlic ones, and this chicken was really tasty! Thanks to the author for sharing!
It turned out really good. I’m really impressed by the recipe
Yummy! My family loved! THANks for sharing!

I generally liked how fast it was to make it. I did have to bake it 8 minutes longer than the suggested bake time. I also added cayenne pepper, garlic seasoning, and onion powder to the list of seasonings to mix in the bowl. It gave the dish some added flavor, along with a pinch of warmth/spice.

This recipe was great! My husband and son couldn't get enough of it. I will be making this again and again.The white wine added a nice touch. The only thing I changed was switching the dijon mustard to honey mustard (it was all l had).
This is an excellent recipe. I made it and my hubby loved it. He’s my tester. I’ll serve this again to my kids when they come over
Yes I will make it again. DELICIOUS!!!!!
Very good. Liked the taste and the breasts were juicy even after putting in oven.
Absolutely delicious! I used very thinly sliced chicken breasts, baked it on a rack in the oven, and served it over romaine lettuce with homemade Caesar salad dressing. My husband loved it!

I had a very large chicken breast defrosted, but no plan for dinner. This recipe was the perfect solution! I cut the recipe in half, filleted the chicken breast thin (instead of pounding it), and it turned out well. The white meat was moist and tender. The only problem I encountered was that the chicken, still cold from the fridge, caused the melted butter in the sauce to congeal and stick to the bowl rather than the fillets. I may try brushing it onto the chicken next time.
Easy and delicious! Even my fussy granddaughter ate it. I did add extra garlic but otherwise I followed the recipe and it was great!
Awesome recipe. Very moist and delicious. Have made it over 5 times now. Still just as food as the first time.
Definitely a make again!
Great recipe!

What a yummy, easy, and flexible dish! Made as directed, except I threw the liquid into a bag and "marinated" the chicken for an hour or so. Could see changing up the spices just to keep things interesting. Will definitely make again and again!
I ended up flipping the chicken halfway through cooking in hopes that it would make both sides crispy...no such luck. BUT the chicken was moist and very flavorful. Overall, excellent recipe!
All I had on had was Sweet Hot Mustard. It was delicious!

I followed the recipe exactly and the chicken came out perfect, at least that’s what my husband said! I honestly don’t think that I’ve had a chicken breast, come out so moist and juicy before. I will definitely make this again.

So delicious, couldn't stop eating them. I used chicken strips instead of whole breasts and baked at 425 for about 20 minutes, which I just do for any chicken recipe. Crispy, tender, and the dijon mustard really made these incredible.
